intro: Psychotria alaotra, commonly known as the Madagascar Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale green flowers. It is often found in humid, lowland forests and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native habitat. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
